item.title: Routing in VIPER Architecture
item.description: The primary function of a Router is to manage the display of a group of scenes, implemented by ViewControllers, using a pattern such as stacking, direct access or serial access.
item.dc:creator: Lyle Resnick

item.title: Solving a Complex UITableView Using the VIPER Architecture
item.description: VIPER is an application architecture - a set of classes that work together to structure a solution.
item.dc:creator: Lyle Resnick

item.title: A Crash Course on the VIPER Architecture
item.description: Iâ€™ve been exploring and using the VIPER architecture now for about 2 years. I think it is a really sensible solution for organizing and reducing the size of a Massive ViewController.
item.dc:creator: Lyle Resnick

item.title: Solving a Complex UITableView Even More Swiftly
item.description: In Solving a Complex UITableView using Swift, we reviewed a solution for solving a complex UITableView. In this article, we will improve the solution by refactoring the code in three ways:
item.dc:creator: Lyle Resnick

item.title: Solving a Complex UITableView using Swift
item.description: In this article we will discuss a technique for solving a complex UITableView. By complex, I mean a tableView that will display many more row types than exist in the source data set - in this case seven. At the same time, we will discuss a simple technique to reduce the size of the UIViewController that owns the tableView.
item.dc:creator: Lyle Resnick
